content.body: I am confused by the SSE spec (https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/server-sent-events.html#parsing-an-event-stream). The ABNF states that a BOM is %xFEFF, the note below says “The UTF-8 decode algorithm strips one leading UTF-8 Byte Order Mark (BOM), if any”, but the referenced Encoding spec says has a table (https://encoding.spec.whatwg.org/#specification-hooks) where the UTF-8 BOM is 0xEF 0xBB 0xBF. Should event stream
webben_: the ABNF is in Unicode, not bytes
oh! That makes sense, thanks annevk!

yoav: you mentioned that implementations would need to know final dimensions of the viewport, for image preloads using width descriptors. Is this already a necessity for the media attr to work in head-found elements (like link preloads) currently?
